intro: Octarrhena elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's octarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact shrub form with small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
